system.description: The true healers of the world, they are committed to sustaining all life. The truly altruistic characters, Life Mages are known to enter battles on neither side, healing anyone and everyone who they can. Obsessed with keeping people alive and conquering death, Life Mages are not as righteous as the Paladin but much more humble and kind. Shying away from combat, they prefer to stand behind the troops, healing when needed. If you are playing a Life Mage be helpful, kind and loving, protective but committed to saving lives and fighting death.

overview.base: Having mastered the basic techniques in this field of magic, you are able to cast more advanced spells. If you create any Elder Sorcery spells of your own, they get added to this list. However, just because you "know" how to cast these spells, doesn't mean you are always prepared to. Although all mage classes grant their own elder sorcery and rotator spells, you may only have a maximum of 2 × (MR - 1) of these spells rotated into your spell list at any given time across all classes. MR refers to the number of ranks you have in mage classes. During a long rest, you can "rotate" which spells you have prepared. The rotator spells automatically available to you are Blessing, Crown of Light, Glow of Healing, Rebirth, and Ward.
overview.proficient: You may instead prepare P of these spells.
overview.fluent: You may instead prepare F of these spells.

overview.base: Choose 1 ability from your deity's domains chart. You may bless 1 target with this ability.
overview.proficient: You may choose 2 × P abilities from your deity's domains chart and bless 2 × P targets with 1 of them.
overview.fluent: You may choose 2 × F abilities from your deity's domains chart and bless 2 × F targets with 2 of them.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, you may target 1 additional creature.
system.requirements: You are not sustaining Blessing.

overview.base: A small circle of golden light circles above your head. You gain Light Touch and Light Aura.

results.hit: Target is lighted.
results.critHit: The target automatically fails the first [[/roll 2d4]] roll.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, deal an additional [[/roll 1d4[magic holy]]] damage as well.
system.endCondition: At the end of each of the target's turns, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

results.fail: Target is lighted.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, You automatically fail the first [[/roll 2d4]] roll.
system.endCondition: At the end of each of the target's turns, they roll [[/roll 2d4]]. If either of these dice roll a 4, this effect ends.

overview.base: You gain Healing Touch and Cure Illness.

results.hit: Target is no longer poisoned and is healed at the start of your next turn.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, target is healed again at the start of your next turn.

overview.base: Make an herbalist check. The GM determines the difficulty based on the severity of the illness. The GM may also require you to have access to specific ingredients or tools or put other conditions in place. If the illness is mental in nature, then Cure Illness acts as a mental effect.
overview.proficient: You are adept at Cure Illness. Before you make the check, you may spend 1 additional MP to know the DC if it is less than your total level. You may also add your proficiency bonus to the herbalist check regardless of whether or not you are proficient in herbalist.

results.save: The target is cured of the illness.
results.fail: The target is not cured, but the illness does not worsen for the duration of Healing Touch. You may cast Cure Illness again to keep the disease from progressing, but you may not attempt the check again.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, The DC of the check is reduced by 1.

overview.proficient: If target is undead, they are healed for Damage P times.
overview.fluent: If target is undead, they are healed for Damage F times.

results.hit: If target is dead, they are brought back to life. If they had less than 1 HP, they have 1 HP. If they had less than 1 MP, they have 1 MP. Otherwise, their HP and MP do not change. If target is undead, you can choose to have them be healed for Damage.

system.heightened: For each additional MP spent, target can have been dead for an additional 10 minutes. If target is undead, they are healed an additional time.
system.requirements: Target is undead or has died within the last 10 minutes.

results.hit: Target item's next attack is warded. You may also target a creature's hand. If you do, the creature's next hand or missile spell is warded.

overview.base: You gain Elder Sorcery Creation, Celestial Elder Sorcery Words, and Life Elder Sorcery Words.

You may create 1 custom "rotator" spells using Elder Sorcery words that you know using whatever Elder Sorcery creation rules are dictated to you by your GM. As with other rotators, this spell is not always available to you. You have to "rotate" into having it prepared. This spell may have a maximum number of words equal to your level. Your GM may allow you to "improvise" spells as well, using whatever rules they wish.
overview.proficient: You may now create 2 × (MR - 1) custom "rotator" spells where MR is the number of ranks you have in mage classes.
overview.fluent: In addition to the spells that you crate, you can learn P additional spells from other Elder Sorcery users. See Elder Sorcery for more information.

value.variable: Creation cost is at least 1 MP per OP of each word in the spell plus 3 × MP of the spell itself.
Creation cost is at least 3 × HP of the spell itself.

costs.materialCost: Creation cost is at least 3 × the material components of the spell itself.

overview.proficient: The OP of words you know is 1 + (3 × P).
overview.fluent: The OP of words you know is 1 + (3 × F).

overview.base:
You know OP 1 Life Elder Sorcery words.
OP 1 Life Elder Sorcery Words

overview.proficient: The OP of words you know is 1 + (3 × P).
overview.fluent: The OP of words you know is 1 + (3 × F).
